meanings.definition: A recurring theme, subject, or idea in a work of art or literature.
meanings.sent1: The motifs of love and friendship are common in romantic novels.
meanings.sent2: The author skillfully weaves motifs of nature throughout the story.
meanings.sent3: The detective novel had a funny twist with motifs of cupcakes and mysteries.
meanings.sent4: Her paintings were like a garden, each canvas blooming with different motifs.
meanings.sent5: The motifs of courage and perseverance resonated with the readers.

meanings.definition: A distinctive feature or dominant idea in a musical composition.
meanings.sent1: The motifs of the melody were catchy and easy to remember.
meanings.sent2: The composer incorporated motifs of joy and sorrow in the symphony.
meanings.sent3: The concert had an unexpected twist with motifs of laughter and surprise.
meanings.sent4: His music was a tapestry, each note forming intricate motifs of emotion.
meanings.sent5: The motifs of rhythm and harmony blended seamlessly in the song.

meanings.definition: A repeated pattern or design in textiles or other decorative arts.
meanings.sent1: The motifs on the rug added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent2: The tapestry displayed intricate motifs of flowers and vines.
meanings.sent3: The pillow cover had quirky motifs of cats and coffee cups.
meanings.sent4: The wallpaper created an illusion of depth with its geometric motifs.
meanings.sent5: The motifs on the dress shimmered under the lights of the fashion show.
